alert.note: Alert for Western Kenai Peninsula (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 10 at 1:56PM AKST until December 12 at 9:00AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM THIS EVENING TO 9 AM AKST MONDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 9 to 18 inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. Visibility reduced to as low as one half mile at times, especially along the Sterling Highway from Kenai to Ninilchik. * WHERE...Western Kenai Peninsula. * WHEN...From 11 PM this evening to 9 AM AKST Monday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute. Heavy snow could cause power outages. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Widespread light snow will develop across the western Kenai Peninsula this evening. Light snow may taper off or come to an end early Sunday morning for areas east of Soldotna. However, light to moderate snow is expected to persist along the immediate Cook Inlet coast through Sunday morning. A second round of moderate to heavy snow is then expected to develop across the entire Western Kenai Peninsula Sunday afternoon and continue through Monday morning before ending from west to east. The heaviest snow amounts are expected along the coast from Kenai south to Ninilchik. Gusty northerly winds will develop in conjunction with the heavier snow Sunday afternoon and continue through Monday morning. The combination of heavy snow and gusty winds could significantly reduce visibility.
info.instruction: A Winter Storm Warning for snow means severe winter weather conditions will make travel very hazardous. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
